mission_data.mission_description: Measures for Measures, Part 3^^You are all that stands between the TSN and impending disaster. Assist a science station in critical research to understand and counter new Skaraan technology.^^Stock ship names required^Multi-ship, level selectable, GM Controls, Comms Buttons^v2.8.1+ required for multi-ship play

big_message.title: Countered Measures
big_message.subtitle2: an adventure by Neal Schlein, for Artemis 2.8.1

log.text: Measures for Measures Part 3: Countered Measures version 1.0

create.name: DS 64
create.hullKeys: Deep Space Base Command Base Base Base

create.name: Iptheth
create.raceKeys: Kralien Skaraan Torgoth standard support hasspecials

event.name: Jump Ready
event.incoming_comms_text: New Skaraan Technology Overview--^^Gravimetric Torpedos ^**Non-targetable^**Limited flight duration^**Can create localized tears in space-time upon detonation^**Deal direct shield and gravitational stress damage^**Reduce maximum shielding capacity upon impact^**Negate ship velocity upon impact^**Successive impacts may permanently reduce structural integrity^---COUNTER MEASURES: REPAIRS AVAILABLE AT STATIONS^^Warp Negation Technology^**Deployment previously observed on stations^**Based on Trithel Particles^**Overloads warp fields^**Generates excessive heat in Engineering^---COUNTER MEASURES: AUTO SHUT-OFF SYSTEM TO REDUCE WARP POWER TO 0^^Non-Magnetic Hull Materials^**Equipped ships do not trigger mines^---COUNTER MEASURES: NONE

Immediate Deployment Orders:^^All ships receiving this message are to deploy to the Trithel Nebula.^^Once there, you are to rendezvous with station Alamo II in order to install prototype equipment and then assist SS Schrodinger I with their research into Trithel Particles.^^Skaraan and other enemy forces are present in the sector; some or all may be equipped with experimental technology. You will need to eliminate them eventually, but begin by focusing on the research.^^Trithel Particles have been weaponized by the Skaraans to dangerously collapse warp fields and reduce maximum shield strength. Therefore, all ships are now configured for immediate shutdown of relevant Engineering systems when interference is detected. Shield repairs are available at stations.^^Good luck.

event.name: Decode Message

set_ship_text.name: Prototypes
set_ship_text.desc: MULTI-SHIP OPTIONS^Upgrade Shields: +20% Boost.^Extra Coolant: +25% coolant.^^SINGLE SHIP OPTIONS^Demagnetized Hull: Bypass mines. ^Bio-Weapon: Deploy pods of Piranhas.^Enemy Transponder: "Change" sides.^Shield Buffer: Boost shields & energy recharge.^Decoy Signal: Deploy decoy ships.^Angled Shields: Adjust shield power.^Organic Repairs: Regenerating repair systems.

set_ship_text.name: Data
set_ship_text.desc: MILITARY INTEL^Sensor range is limted to 16k within the Trithel Nebula.^^High concentrations of Trithel Particles will collapse warp fields (cause: Unknown).

event.set_ship_text: Query Subject: Trithel Particles^^Reference: Trithel Nebula^Location: Outer Grant Sector (contested regions)^Mapping Status: Unmapped (95% Incomplete)^^Notes:^1. The Trithel Nebula Contains unique particles which immediately collapse warp fields (reason unknown). Named after nebula discoverer, Dr. Henry Trithel.^^2. Targeting sensors require proximity callibration within regions of Trithel particles.^^3. Sensor range is limited within the Trithel Nebula. Use extreme caution.^^4. TSN Astrometrics theorizes that Trithel particles are the result of a massive gravimetric explosions.
event.incoming_comms_text: Measures for Measures Series Summary^^Part 1: Invasive Measures^A pre-emptive deep-strike against a secret Skaraan research base reveals the enemy has developed several new technologies based on Trithel Particles.^^Part 2: Disparate Measures^In order to counter this new threat, prototype systems are deployed for immediate testing...just before the enemy arrives to destroy them and the design team.^^Part 3: Countered Measures^WIth the prototypes in hand and enemy forces nearby, finding a way to counter the new enemy threats is of the utmost importance.

Multi-Ship play is fully functional in 2.8.1^^Multi-ship play is functional in 2.8.0 , with the following notes:^--Selection menus will appear for all ships but only apply to the active, docked ship.^--Activation buttons will appear on all ships, but only apply to the ship with that prototype installed.^^To avoid confusion when using 2.8.0, and particularly for new Comms Officers, it is suggested that all but one ship select from the following protype options:^--Shield Boost (available to every ship)^--Extra Coolant (available to every ship)^--Organic Repair Circuitry (Limited to 1 ship)

This script makes heavy use of Comms buttons and generic meshes to convey information. Review the supplemental script "Prototype Experimentation" to test the interface.^^There are secret tactical options, changes to the base game, and new tech. In particular, please note:^--Only one ship at a time (first docked) is provided with the prototype menu.^--Pirate ships can dock immediately.^--If all of your DamCon teams are killed, station Schrodinger can send help.^--Engineering Warp sliders will power off in certain situations (it's a "safety" feature!), unless _____.^--The enemy has new weapons and abilities.^--Almost everything can be countered or has a limitation if you experiment and pay attention.^^Multi-ship play is mostly functional in 2.8.0, and fully functional in 2.8.1. Check the Read Me for more.^^^Have fun!^Neal (aka Belroc)
kidnkm, i034,dkdjfklsjm; p03;lkjldhn fjlkejinifneijsdklnmkdlj ^^ejrilehjwln.cd;j;ijeiorjnklnml;^4

event.name: Mission Orders
event.incoming_comms_text: Welcome to the Trithel Nebula.^^We're glad to have you on hand to assist with our research.^^After you dock with Alamo II, please investigate the randomly forming and collapsing gravity wells. Get close, conduct some scans, maybe experiment with power settings in their vicinity, and transfer the data back to us. There must be a way to counteract the effect Trithel Particles have on warp drives.^^The enemy hasn't attacked yet, so it's possible that if you don't stray too far they will hold off--but we aren't armed like you are.^^If you get in trouble and all your repair teams are injured, we can send a jump ship.^^^---End of Message---

set_ship_text.name: Beau Cavalier
set_ship_text.hailtext: This is the Beau Cavalier. We'll play along with anything...for enough cash. ^^So...whatcha got in mind?

set_ship_text.name: Long Haul
set_ship_text.hailtext: Long Haul, here; this has been a major trip.^^We would like to thank Greybeard, Gypsy, Admirals UE and VonErebos, Captain Bennett, EvanPie, and Deener for their invaluable assistance in making sure we survived the prototype testing.

set_ship_text.name: Falcon
set_ship_text.hailtext: We are on defense duty. What do you need?

set_ship_text.name: Hawk
set_ship_text.hailtext: We are on defense duty. What do you need?

set_ship_text.name: Observer
set_ship_text.hailtext: This is the Observer; we're looking for our cat. Have you seen it?

event.name: Random Incoming Fleets
event.incoming_comms_text: We have been trying to reach you about your ship's extended warranty. ^^This is your final warning: Act now to avoid losing coverage!

log.text: A new fleet was detected on the edge of space...and a SPAM message was received asking us to renew the ship's extended warranty!

event.name: All Enemy Stations Destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: New intelligence indicates that the enemy has decided not to commit additional resources to the system. ^Good work.^^All you need to do is clean up what is already there!

set_ship_text.desc: Produced by extreme gravity; de-ionized by weapon radiaton. ^^MILITARY INTEL^Sensor range limted to 33k within the Trithel Nebula.^^Trithel Particles collapse warp fields. ^Raise beams above 204% to counteract.

event.set_ship_text: Query Subject: Trithel Particles^^Reference: Trithel Nebula^Location: Outer Grant Sector (contested regions)^Mapping Status: Unmapped (95% Incomplete)^^Notes:^1. The Trithel Nebula Contains unique particles which immediately collapse warp fields (reason unknown). Named after nebula discoverer, Dr. Henry Trithel.^^2. Targeting sensors require proximity callibration within regions of Trithel particles.^^3. Sensor range is limited within the Trithel Nebula. Use extreme caution.^^4. TSN Astrometrics theorizes that Trithel particles are the result of a massive gravimetric explosions.

set_ship_text.desc: Produced by extreme gravity; de-ionized by weapon radiaton. ^^MILITARY INTEL^Sensor range limted to 33k within the Trithel Nebula.^^Trithel Particles collapse warp fields. ^Beam strength to counter: >204%

event.set_ship_text: Query Subject: Trithel Particles^^Reference: Trithel Nebula^Location: Outer Grant Sector (contested regions)^Mapping Status: Unmapped (95% Incomplete)^^Notes:^1. The Trithel Nebula Contains unique particles which immediately collapse warp fields (reason unknown). Named after nebula discoverer, Dr. Henry Trithel.^^2. Targeting sensors require proximity callibration within regions of Trithel particles.^^3. Sensor range is limited within the Trithel Nebula. Use extreme caution.^^4. event.incoming_comms_text: This is Dr. Trithel.^^We have the calculation for you.^^Beam power settings above 204% standard will de-ionize enough Trithel Particles to maintain a warp field regardless of their concentration.^^^If you're interested in the exact particle dynamics, you can read about it in the article I just submitted to the journal Impractical Astrophysics. Riveting stuff.^^^Thank you for all your help!

event.incoming_comms_text: This is Dr. Trithel.^^It's confirmed: The energy output of military-grade weapons causes de-ionization of Trithel Particles. We never would have discovered this with standard science vessels!^^I'm still working on a precise value, but routing 250% power to your beams should be more than adequate to maintain warp fields.^^This is going to finish off dissertations for several of my students! Thank you!^^^

log.text: Data sent to station. Resarch station Schrodinger 1 has determined that beam power in excess of 225% will counteract the effects of Trithel Particles.

event.incoming_comms_text: This is Dr. Trithel.^I have the entire research team in here going through your sensor logs.^^We have confirmed the unknown sensor readings as de-ionized Trithel Particles. They disipate quickly, but seem to form around your ship's weapon systems in proportion to power flow. Most importantly, they can repel normal particles!^^We can't put a number on it yet, but with enough power directed to your Beam system you should be able to surround your whole ship and prevent interference with your warp field!

set_ship_text.name: Request Specs
set_ship_text.desc: Scan to send specs for all upgrades to Comms.

event.name: Send Specs to Comms
event.incoming_comms_text: New Skaraan Technology Overview--^^Gravimetric Torpedos ^**Reduce target's maximum shielding capacity^**Negate ship velocity upon impact^**May cause direct damage (reports vary)^**Can create localized tears in space-time^**Non-Targetable^**Limited duration^^Warp Negation Technology^**Based on Trithel Particles^**Overloads warp fields^**Deployment observed on stations^^Non-Magnetic Hull Materials^**Equipped ships do not trigger mines
Spec Sheet: Organic Circuitry^^--Damage repair systems regenerate naturally.^--1 random team will regenerate 1 member each minute.^--Full regeneration cycle takes 18 minutes+^

Spec Sheets: Angled Shields^^--Angle shields to front, rear, or evenly balanced^--Front focus: 150% forward / 50% rear^--Rear focus: 50% forward / 150% rear^--Balanced: 100% forward / 100% rear^--Deflects gravitational damage^^NOTE: Minor transfer loss will result in temporary reduction of overall shield strength. ^^Successive quick changes are not recommended during combat.

Spec Sheets: Sensor Decoys^^--Deploys two distortion beacons enhanced with basic weapons and thrusters^--Beacons may be directed as per normal allied ships^--Beacons will be destroyed upon taking any damage^--Beacon Power Duration: 2 minutes

Spec Sheet: Shield Buffer^^--Requires Shields to be raised for activation.^--Buffer cycles every 10 seconds and restores shields and energy.^--After deactivation, boosts shields by fraction of damage taken per cycle.^--Deactivation restores ship energy based upon number of activated cycles.^--Generates heat in all engineering subsystems (increases with length of activation)

Spec Sheets: False Transponder^^--Ship broadcasts enemy ID signal.^--Temporarily appears to be part of enemy fleet.^--Duration varies (appx. 15-30 seconds).^--Passive reset scans require 5 minutes.^--Can confuse drones and unguided missiles.^^NOTE: Allied ships and stations will react according to perceived ID signal.
Spec Sheet: Bio Weapon (Pods)^^--Rear-deploys a fake wreck loaded with 3 piranhas.^--4 pods installed; additional stores upon redock^--Requires proximity triggering by a TSN ship.^
Spec Sheet: Coolant Upgrade^^--+2 total Engineering Coolant^--Immediate and permanent addition

Spec Sheet: Mine Bypass^^--Temporarily demagnetizes hull (appx. 15 seconds)^--Ship will not trigger mines while demagnetized.^--Requires recharge after use, appx. 3 minutes^^Note: Mines can still be exploded by other nearby ships.
Spec Sheet: Shield Boost^^--20% boost to maximum front shields^--20% boost to maximum rear shields^--Immediate increase, based upon current maximum strength.

Prototype Overview^^--Shield Boost (20% increase to each shield.)^^--Mine Bypass (Temporarily allows ship to fly near mines.)^^--Coolant Upgrade (+25% Engineering Coolant.)^^--Bio Weapon (Deploys a wreck with piranhas; 4 uses. Requires triggering.)^^--False Transponder (Broadcasts enemy ID signal.)^^--Shield Buffer (Stores energy from damaged shields for power and shield recharge. Generates heat.)^^--Sensor Decoys (Deploy two commandable sensor decoys for 2 minutes.)^^--Shield Angling (Focus shield deflectors to front, back, or balanced.)^^--Organic Circuitry (Self-regenerating Damcon teams.)

event.name: Passcodes recovered
event.incoming_comms_text: We just learned that a secure case with the prototype's removal passcodes survived the explosion and has now been recovered!^^The technicians can begin swapping out upgrades again.

log.text: Design team's passcodes have been recovered! Protoypes can again be removed and reinstalled.

event.name: Disable Explanation Station Destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: Alert to all ships!^^The remaining prototypes and underlying research was all lost with the destruction of Station Alamo II!^^The lone surviving technician says that any attempt to remove your current prototypes without the proper passcodes will result in a total system meltdown.^^Hopefully you have what you need!

event.name: Disable Explanation to Comms
event.incoming_comms_text: Alert to all ships!^^The prototype design team has been killed in an explosion!^^We don't know whether this was an enemy attack or a seriously unfortunate accident, but it's bad either way.^^The surviving technicians have informed us that they can no longer remove your installed prototypes or exchange them. Secret passcodes are needed to prevent total system meltdown, and only the lead developers had them.^^Everyone is pretty shaken, but the techs say they can still install something on any ship without an existing prototype.^

log.text: Station Alamo II has been destroyed--and with it all of the prototypes!
An explosion on board station Alamo II has killed the prototype design team. Without their secret codes, prototypes can no longer be removed!

event.name: Enemy Destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: You've done a great service this day.^^Now that we can counter the Skaraan's new technology we can keep them at bay.^^You've done well by any measure.

log.text: All enemies defeated. Mission is a success!
All players destroyed. 1-time, 20 second window to spawn a new ship...
All player ships eliminated for a second time. Mission failed.
